title: Waterfall Country Explorer
suitableFor: Families with children aged 8+, adventurous couples, and photographers seeking stunning scenery. Hikers comfortable with uneven terrain.
notSuitableFor: Those with limited mobility due to uneven terrain and some steep sections. Anyone afraid of heights might find gorge walking challenging.

stops.title: Gorge Walking in Waterfall Country
stops.description: Scramble through the river gorge, navigate small waterfalls, and enjoy the thrill of the Brecon Beacons' natural playground.

wetAlt.title: Craig y Nos Castle Tour
wetAlt.description: Explore the historic Craig y Nos Castle, once home to opera singer Adelina Patti.

budgetAlt.title: Explore the Ystradfellte Nature Reserve
budgetAlt.description: Hike through the woodlands and discover smaller, less-known waterfalls.

stops.title: The Old Waterwheel Tearoom
stops.description: A charming tearoom serving light lunches, homemade cakes, and local Welsh specialties.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Pontneddfechan picnic site
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own food at the scenic picnic area near the village.

stops.title: Four Falls Trail Hike
stops.description: Embark on a circular walk visiting four distinct waterfalls, including the famous Sgwd yr Eira, which you can walk behind.

wetAlt.title: National Showcaves Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore a network of caves and dinosaur exhibits.

budgetAlt.title: Free: Explore Pontneddfechan Village
budgetAlt.description: Wander through the quaint village and admire the surrounding scenery.

stops.title: Waterfall Country Campsite
stops.description: A well-maintained campsite located close to the waterfalls, ideal for experiencing the natural beauty of the area.

budgetAlt.title: Wild Camping (permit required)
budgetAlt.description: If you are experienced and responsible, you can obtain a permit for wild camping in certain areas.

stops.title: The Lamb Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub in Pontneddfechan, serving hearty meals and local ales.

budgetAlt.title: Cook your own at the campsite
budgetAlt.description: Prepare a simple meal using your camping stove and supplies.

stops.title: Sgwd yr Eira walk-behind waterfall
stops.description: Hike to Sgwd yr Eira, a stunning waterfall you can walk behind, for a unique and memorable experience.

wetAlt.title: Brecon Mountain Railway
wetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic steam train ride through the Brecon Beacons National Park.

budgetAlt.title: Free: Explore more of the Brecon Beacons National Park.
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the views of the open fields and rolling hills.

stops.title: The Red Lion Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub located in Penderyn, offering a cozy atmosphere and classic pub fare.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic at Llyn Cwm Llwch
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your lunch beside the stunning glacial lake beneath Pen y Fan.

stops.title: Pen y Fan Hike (Short Route)
stops.description: Take a shorter, more accessible route to the summit of Pen y Fan for panoramic views (weather permitting!).

wetAlt.title: Brecon Beacons Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Learn about the history, geology, and wildlife of the Brecon Beacons.

budgetAlt.title: Free: Shorter Walk around Storey Arms
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a walk around the Storey Arms and take in the local views.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Expect changeable weather, even in summer. Rain is common, so pack waterproof gear. Check the forecast before heading out.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on weekends and during school holidays, especially around popular attractions. Parking at Waterfall Country can fill up quickly, arrive early or consider using public transport.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Gorge walking with Adventure Britain needs to be booked in advance, especially during peak season. Accommodation should also be booked ahead of time.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A moderate level of fitness is required for the gorge walking and hiking. The Four Falls Trail involves some uneven terrain and steps. The shorter Pen y Fan route is manageable for most, but still involves some uphill walking.
